ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] About loot order
ygData.msgSnippet: What do you have to keep track of? Its just one person.  If its me I get rid of all my pp and gold give to a tank to hold that way its easier to just /split x
ygData.messageBody:
What do you have to keep track of? Its just one person.  If its me I get rid of all my pp and gold give to a tank to hold that way its easier to just /split x x as we go.  I just write down how much I have after each split so I know whets mine and whets theirs.  Every few mobs you just type /s 12, I usually come out on the short end of the stick because I round up a lot and everyone else winds up getting more but no big deal its worth it not to have to target corpses or try and look over them.
 
Mu
-----Original Message-----
From: LeSamLam@... [mailto:LeSamLam@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 03, 2001 9:19 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] About loot order

I've never been in a group that has done that.  Seems to me that that would
be kinda hard to keep track of.  

Yup, I kick those people out.  The groups I am in now we don't FFA, Alpha or
roll for anything that's not a special drop.  I would say 99% of the time
the group picks someone we can trust and someone with more than two bags of
free space to hold loot and that person loots everything and when its time
for someone to leave he splits the pp and the items that he has looted.
This system works very well for most the groups I have been in.

Mu



Lena
mom to Jordan Trevor 6-1-93, Joshua Tyler (Josh) 12-6-94 & Joseph Trey (Joey)
10-19-99
and wife to Jason
